alert.note: Alert for Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, CENTRAL SWITZERLAND, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHWESTERN GRANT AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Vevay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, penny size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Rising Sun, Warsaw, Florence, Glencoe, Patriot, Center Square, Aberdeen, Ryle, Big Bone Lick, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Steele Bottom, Markland, Rabbit Hash, Beaverlick, Quercus Grove, North Landing, Jacksonville, Egypt Bottom, US Route 42 at State Route 184 and Elliston. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 60 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
